content: Inland waterways, including the Inland Waterway System managed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, cover 38 states and handle approximately half of all inland waterway freight. The Corps develops, operates, and maintains infrastructure such as navigation channels, harbors, locks, and dams. The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers manages the Inland Waterway System, covering 38 states and handling half of all inland waterway freight. The Corps funds maintenance and construction through appropriations and user fees, covering 100% of studies and operations and maintenance costs.
